paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the TTR gene variant p.Val30Met, including penetrance data and patient demographics.

patients.demographics: 65 year-old Caucasian male, 63 year-old Caucasian male

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Here, we described the generation of two iPSC lines derived from a 65 year-old Caucasian male patient (SCVIi066-A) diagnosed with transthyretin cardiac amyloidosis due to a heterozygous mutation in the TTR gene (c.148G>A encoding p.Val30Met; pathogenic variant).

Here, we described the generation of two iPSC lines derived from a 63 year-old Caucasian male patient (SCVIi067-A) diagnosed with transthyretin cardiac amyloidosis due to a heterozygous mutation in the TTR gene (c.148G>A encoding p.Val30Met; pathogenic variant).

functional_data.summary: The iPSC lines showed expression of high levels of pluripotency markers and normal karyotype.

variants.segregation_data: The mutation segregates with disease in the two patients described.
variants.source_location: Main Text, Abstract and Resource details
variants.additional_notes: The Val30Met mutation is one of the most common mutations in the TTR gene.
key_quotes: The mutation Val30Met (also known as V50M) is one of the most common mutations in the TTR gene and is endemic in some countries (e.g., Portugal and Sweden).

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data was extracted from the main text.
